definition: to abandon self for others (idiom); to sacrifice oneself to help the people/altruism
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: Eg: The heroes made an instant decision to risk their own lives to save others.
sentences.chinese: 英雄们立刻做出了舍己救人的决定。

definition: to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
to see what is right and act courageously (idiom, from Analects); to stand up bravely for the truth/acting heroically in a just cause
for the common good and forgetting personal interests (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
to pick up money and not hide it (idiom); to return property to its owner
to give up one's private interests for the public good (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless and public spirited
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
deed/past achievement/important event of the past
